Baseline alignment
trans-unit.target: Alineación de la línea de base

trans-unit.source: Baseline alignment: the baseline keyword, plus optionally one of first or last.
trans-unit.target: Alineación de línea de base: la palabra clave de baseline , más opcionalmente una de la first o la last .

trans-unit.source: Baseline content alignment — specifying a baseline alignment value for justify-content or align-content — works in layout methods that lay items out in rows. The alignment subjects are baseline aligned against each other by adding padding inside the boxes.
trans-unit.target: La alineación del contenido de la línea de base, que especifica un valor de alineación de la línea de base para justify-content o align-content , funciona en métodos de diseño que colocan los elementos en filas. Los temas de alineación están alineados entre sí mediante la adición de relleno dentro de los cuadros.

trans-unit.source: Baseline self alignment shifts the boxes to align by baseline by adding a margin outside the boxes. Self alignment is when using justify-self or align-self, or when setting these values as a group with justify-items and align-items.
trans-unit.target: La autoalineación de la línea base desplaza los cuadros para alinearlos por la línea base al agregar un margen fuera de los cuadros. La autoalineación es cuando se usa justify-self o align-self , o cuando se configuran estos valores como un grupo con justify-items y align-items .

trans-unit.source: Because <gradient>s belong to the <image> data type, they can only be used where <image>s can be used. For this reason, conic-gradient() won't work on background-color and other properties that use the <color> data type.

Because <gradient>s belong to the <image> data type, they can only be used where <image>s can be used. For this reason, linear-gradient() won't work on background-color and other properties that use the <color> data type.
trans-unit.target: Debido a que <gradient> s pertenecen al tipo de datos <image> , solo se pueden usar donde se pueden usar <image> s. Por esta razón, linear-gradient() no funcionará en background-color y otras propiedades que usan el tipo de datos <color> .

trans-unit.source: Because <gradient>s belong to the <image> data type, they can only be used where <image>s can be used. For this reason, radial-gradient() won't work on background-color and other properties that use the <color> data type.

trans-unit.source: Because <gradient>s belong to the <image> data type, they can only be used where <image>s can be used. For this reason, repeating-conic-gradient() won't work on background-color and other properties that use the <color> data type.

Because <gradient>s belong to the <image> data type, they can only be used where <image>s can be used. For this reason, repeating-linear-gradient() won't work on background-color and other properties that use the <color> data type.

trans-unit.source: Because <gradient>s belong to the <image> data type, they can only be used where <image>s can be used. For this reason, repeating-radial-gradient() won't work on background-color and other properties that use the <color> data type.
trans-unit.target: Debido a que <gradient> s pertenecen al tipo de datos <image> , solo se pueden usar donde se pueden usar <image> s. Por esta razón, repeating-radial-gradient() no funcionará en background-color y otras propiedades que usan el tipo de datos <color> .

trans-unit.source: Because High Contrast Mode themes are dynamic, use these color keywords in place of other CSS color values. This will ensure that content will always be able to be perceived.
Because High Contrast Mode themes are dynamic, use these color keywords in place of other CSS color values. This will ensure that content will always be able to be perceived.

Because many websites have not been developed with small devices in mind, mobile browsers differ from desktop browsers in the way they render web pages. Instead of laying out pages at the width of the device screen, they lay them out using a viewport that is much wider, usually 800 or 1000 pixels. To map the extra-wide layout back to the original device size, they either show only part of the whole render or scale the viewport down to fit.
trans-unit.target: Debido a que muchos sitios web no se han desarrollado con dispositivos pequeños en mente, los navegadores móviles difieren de los navegadores de escritorio en la forma en que representan las páginas web. En lugar de diseñar páginas en el ancho de la pantalla del dispositivo, las presentan utilizando una ventana gráfica que es mucho más ancha, generalmente de 800 o 1000 píxeles. Para asignar el diseño extra ancho al tamaño original del dispositivo, muestran solo una parte de todo el renderizado o reducen la vista para ajustarla.

trans-unit.source: Because media queries provide insights into the capabilities—and by extension, the features and design—of the device the user is working with, there is the potential that they could be abused to construct a "fingerprint" which identifies the device, or at least categorizes it to some degree of detail that may be undesirable to users.

Because of this potential, a browser may opt to fudge the returned values in some manner in order to prevent them from being used to precisely identify a computer. A browser might also offer additional measures in this area; for example, if Firefox's "Resist Fingerprinting" setting is enabled, many media queries report default values rather than values representing the actual device state.

Because selectors do not work with anonymous boxes, they cannot be styled via a stylesheet. This means that all inheritable CSS properties have the inherit value, and all non-inheritable CSS properties, have the initial value.
trans-unit.target: Debido a que los selectores no funcionan con cuadros anónimos, no se pueden diseñar a través de una hoja de estilo. Esto significa que todas las propiedades CSS heredables tienen el valor de inherit , y todas las propiedades CSS no heredables tienen el valor initial .

trans-unit.source: Because the text-underline-position property inherits and is not reset by the text-decoration shorthand property, it may be appropriate to set its value at a global level. For example, the under value may be appropriate for a document with lots of chemical and mathematical formulas, which make a large use of subscripts.
trans-unit.target: Debido a que la propiedad text-underline-position hereda y no se restablece mediante la propiedad abreviada text-decoration , puede ser apropiado establecer su valor a nivel global. Por ejemplo, el valor under puede ser apropiado para un documento con muchas fórmulas químicas y matemáticas, que hacen un gran uso de subíndices.

trans-unit.source: Because the last color stop is 10% and the gradient is vertical, each gradient in the repeated gradient is 10% of the height, fitting 10 horizontal bars.

Before Chrome 26, if background images are clipped (for example, when using background-image sprites) and -webkit-print-color-adjust is set to exact, then backgrounds will appear distorted when printed. Solid backgrounds and background images that are not clipped (i.e., backgrounds that have narrower and shorter than the element to which they are applied) are printed correctly. See Chromium bug 131054.
Before Chrome 4, run-in was not supported before inline elements.
trans-unit.target: Antes de Chrome 4, run-in no contó con el apoyo antes de elementos en línea.

trans-unit.source: Before Chrome 4, the slash / notation is unsupported. If two values are specified, then an elliptical border is drawn on all four corners. -webkit-border-radius: 40px 10px; is equivalent to border-radius: 40px / 10px;.
Before Chrome 41, the implementation was buggy and reported (hover: none) on non-touch-based computers with a mouse/trackpad. See bug 441613.
trans-unit.target: Antes de Chrome 41, la implementación tenía errores y se informaba (hover: none) en computadoras no táctiles con mouse / trackpad. Ver error 441613 .

trans-unit.source: Before Chrome 52, :in-range matched disabled and read-only inputs (see Chromium bug 602568). In Chrome 52, it was changed to only match enabled read-write inputs.
trans-unit.target: Antes de Chrome 52 ,: :in-range coincidía las entradas deshabilitadas y de solo lectura (ver Chromium bug 602568 ). En Chrome 52, se modificó para que solo coincida con las entradas de lectura-escritura habilitadas.

trans-unit.source: Before Chrome 62, the text-transform property does not work on ::first-line pseudo-elements. See Chromium bug 129669.
trans-unit.target: Antes de Chrome 62, la propiedad de text-transform no funciona en ::first-line pseudoelementos de primera línea . Ver Chromium bug 129669 .

trans-unit.source: Before Edge 15, this value was supported with the prefixed version of the property only.
Before Edge 16, Microsoft Edge treats all unknown elements (such as custom elements) as the same element type.
Before Firefox 14, some punctuation characters could interfere with correct capitalization. See bug 731536.
Before Firefox 15, plaintext didn't do anything to an inline element. The specification changed and the implementation was changed in Firefox 15.
trans-unit.target: Antes de Firefox 15, el plaintext no hacía nada a un elemento en línea. La especificación cambió y la implementación se modificó en Firefox 15.

trans-unit.source: Before Firefox 16, the translation values of matrix() and matrix3d() could be <length>s, in addition to the standard <number>.

trans-unit.source: Before Firefox 38, Firefox added a dot as suffix of the number for ethiopic-numeric (for example, ፫. instead of ፫). The specification later defined the absence of a suffix, which Firefox 38 followed.

trans-unit.source: Before Firefox 4, the <percentage> was relative to the width of the box even when specifying the radius for a height. This implied that -moz-border-radius-bottomleft was always drawing an arc of circle, and never an ellipse, when followed by a single value.
trans-unit.target: Antes de Firefox 4, el <percentage> era relativo al ancho del cuadro, incluso cuando se especificaba el radio para una altura. Esto implicaba que -moz-border-radius-bottomleft siempre dibujaba un arco de círculo, y nunca una elipse, cuando seguía un único valor.

trans-unit.source: Before Firefox 4, the <percentage> was relative to the width of the box even when specifying the radius for a height. This implied that -moz-border-radius-bottomright was always drawing an arc of circle, and never an ellipse, when followed by a single value.
trans-unit.target: Antes de Firefox 4, el <percentage> era relativo al ancho del cuadro, incluso cuando se especificaba el radio para una altura. Esto implicaba que -moz-border-radius-bottomright siempre dibujaba un arco de círculo, y nunca una elipse, cuando seguía un solo valor.

trans-unit.source: Before Firefox 4, the <percentage> was relative to the width of the box even when specifying the radius for a height. This implied that -moz-border-radius-topright was always drawing an arc of circle, and never an ellipse, when followed by a single value.

trans-unit.target: Antes de Firefox 44, el oblique no se distinguía de la italic .

trans-unit.source: Before Firefox 44, position: fixed didn't create a stacking context in most cases. Firefox and the specification have been modified to mimic Chrome and Safari's long-time behavior.
trans-unit.target: Antes de Firefox 44, position: fixed no creaba un contexto de apilamiento en la mayoría de los casos. Firefox y la especificación se han modificado para imitar el comportamiento a largo plazo de Chrome y Safari.

trans-unit.source: Before Firefox 50, :in-range matched disabled and read-only inputs (see bug 1264157). In Firefox 50, it was changed to only match enabled read-write inputs.
trans-unit.target: Antes de Firefox 50 ,: :in-range coincidía las entradas deshabilitadas y de solo lectura (ver error 1264157 ). En Firefox 50, se modificó para que solo coincida con las entradas de lectura-escritura habilitadas.

trans-unit.target: Antes de Firefox 50, el valor de plaintext se ignoraba para los modos de escritura vertical ( error 1302734 ).

trans-unit.source: Before Firefox 53, this property was not animatable.
trans-unit.target: Antes de Firefox 53,esta propiedad no era animable.

trans-unit.target: Antes de Firefox 57 calc(1*2*3) no se analiza con éxito.

trans-unit.target: Antes de Firefox 57,Firefox no repinta los elementos fuera del visor que se animan en el visor con un retraso.Este error sólo afecta a algunas plataformas,como Windows.

trans-unit.source: Before Firefox 57, Firefox had a bug where ::after pseudo-elements were still generated, even if the content property value were set to normal or none.
trans-unit.target: Antes de Firefox 57, Firefox tenía un error donde ::after de que todavía se generaban pseudo-elementos, incluso si el valor de la propiedad de content se establecía en normal o none .

trans-unit.source: Before Firefox 57, Firefox had a bug where ::before pseudo-elements were still generated, even if the content property value were set to normal or none.
trans-unit.target: Antes de Firefox 57, Firefox tenía un error en el que ::before todavía se generaban pseudoelementos, incluso si el valor de la propiedad de content estaba establecido en normal o none .

trans-unit.source: Before Firefox 57, absolute positioning did not work correctly when applied to elements inside tables that have border-collapse applied to them (bug 1379306).
trans-unit.target: Antes de Firefox 57, el posicionamiento absoluto no funcionaba correctamente cuando se aplicaba a elementos dentro de tablas que tenían aplicado un border-collapse ( error 1379306 ).

trans-unit.source: Before Firefox 57, animations using em units are not affected by changes to the font-size of the animated element's parent (bug 1254424).
trans-unit.target: Antes de Firefox 57, las animaciones que utilizan unidades em no se ven afectadas por los cambios en el font-size de fuente del elemento primario animado ( error 1254424 ).

trans-unit.source: Before Firefox 57, cancelling a filling animation (for example, with animation-fill-mode: forwards set) can trigger a transition set on the same element, although only once (see bug 1192592 and these test cases for more information).
trans-unit.target: Antes de Firefox 57, cancelar una animación de relleno (por ejemplo, con animation-fill-mode: forwards set) puede desencadenar un conjunto de transición en el mismo elemento, aunque solo una vez (consulte el error 1192592 y estos casos de prueba para obtener más información).

trans-unit.source: Before Firefox 57, some language settings' inherited font-size is smaller than expected (bug 1391341).
trans-unit.target: Antes de Firefox 57, el font-size heredado de algunas configuraciones de idioma es más pequeño de lo esperado ( error 1391341 ).

trans-unit.source: Before Firefox 57, the background-position property can't be transitioned between two values containing different numbers of <position> values, for example background-position: 10px 10px; and background-position: 20px 20px, 30px 30px; (see bug 1390446).
trans-unit.target: Antes de Firefox 57, la propiedad de background-position no se puede hacer la transición entre dos valores que contienen diferentes números de valores de <position> , por ejemplo background-position: 10px 10px; y background-position: 20px 20px, 30px 30px; (ver error 1390446 ).

trans-unit.source: Before Firefox 57, transitions do not work when transitioning from a text-shadow with a color specified to a text-shadow without a color specified (see bug 726550).
trans-unit.target: Antes de Firefox 57, las transiciones no funcionan cuando se pasa de una text-shadow con un color especificado a una text-shadow sin un color especificado (ver error 726550 ).

trans-unit.source: Before Internet Explorer 7, Internet Explorer incorrectly interprets clip: auto as clip: rect(auto, auto, auto, auto).
trans-unit.target: Antes de Internet Explorer 7, Internet Explorer interpreta incorrectamente clip: auto como clip: rect(auto, auto, auto, auto) .

trans-unit.source: Before Opera 11.60, replaced elements with border-radius do not have rounded corners.

trans-unit.target: Antes de Opera 15, Opera no maneja elementos insertados dinámicamente para :nth-child() .

trans-unit.source: Before Opera 39, :in-range matched disabled and read-only inputs (see Chromium bug 602568). In Opera 39, it was changed to only match enabled read-write inputs.

trans-unit.source: Before Safari 5, run-in was not supported before inline elements.
trans-unit.target: Antes de Safari 5, run-in no contó con el apoyo antes de elementos en línea.

trans-unit.source: Before Safari 5, the slash / notation is unsupported. If two values are specified, then an elliptical border is drawn on all four corners. -webkit-border-radius: 40px 10px; is equivalent to border-radius: 40px / 10px;.
Before Samsung Internet 8.0, the text-transform property does not work on ::first-line pseudo-elements. See Chromium bug 129669.
Before WebView 62, the text-transform property does not work on ::first-line pseudo-elements. See Chromium bug 129669.

Before about 2010, the CSS:visited selector allowed websites to uncover a user's browsing history and figure out what sites the user had visited. This was done through window.getComputedStyle and other techniques. This process was quick to execute, and made it possible not only to determine where the user had been on the web, but could also be used to guess a lot of information about the user's identity.
trans-unit.target: Antes de aproximadamente 2010, el selector CSS :visited permitió que los sitios web descubrieran el historial de navegación de un usuario y descubrieran qué sitios había visitado el usuario. Esto se hizo a través de window.getComputedStyle y otras técnicas. Este proceso fue rápido de ejecutar e hizo posible no solo determinar dónde había estado el usuario en la web, sino que también podría usarse para adivinar mucha información sobre la identidad del usuario.

trans-unit.source: Before using any shorthand it is worth remembering that shorthands not only enable the setting of many properties in one go, they also act to reset things to their initial values that you do not, or cannot set in the shorthand. Therefore if you use a shorthand, be aware that it may reset things you have applied elsewhere.
trans-unit.target: Antes de usar cualquier abreviatura, vale la pena recordar que las abreviaturas no solo permiten la configuración de muchas propiedades de una sola vez, sino que también actúan para restablecer las cosas a sus valores iniciales que usted no puede o no puede establecer en la abreviatura. Por lo tanto, si usa una taquigrafía, tenga en cuenta que puede restablecer las cosas que ha aplicado en otros lugares.

Before we can make sense of these properties we need to consider the concept of available space. What we are doing when we change the value of these flex properties is to change the way that available space is distributed amongst our items. This concept of available space is also important when we come to look at aligning items.
trans-unit.target: Antes de que podamos dar sentido a estas propiedades, debemos considerar el concepto de espacio disponible . Lo que estamos haciendo cuando cambiamos el valor de estas propiedades flexibles es cambiar la forma en que se distribuye el espacio disponible entre nuestros artículos. Este concepto de espacio disponible también es importante cuando buscamos alinear elementos.

trans-unit.source: Browser support for @viewport is weak at this time, with support being largely available in Internet Explorer and Edge. Even in those browsers, only a small number of descriptors are available. Browsers will ignore @viewport if they don't support it, and will ignore any descriptors that they don't recognize.
trans-unit.target: El soporte del navegador para @viewport es débil en este momento, y el soporte está ampliamente disponible en Internet Explorer y Edge. Incluso en esos navegadores, solo hay un pequeño número de descriptores disponibles. Los navegadores ignorarán @viewport si no lo admiten e ignorarán cualquier descriptor que no reconozcan.

trans-unit.source: Browser support for display:contents is limited and required for this demo to work. Firefox supports display: contents already, and the value is being implemented in Chrome. Once there is better browser support this feature will be very useful in circumstances where you need the markup for semantic reasons but do not want to display the box that it would generate by default.
trans-unit.target: Soporte del navegador para la display:contents es limitado y se requiere para que esta demostración funcione. Firefox admite display: contents ya, y el valor se está implementando en Chrome. Una vez que haya una mejor compatibilidad con el navegador, esta característica será muy útil en circunstancias en las que necesite el marcado por razones semánticas, pero no desee mostrar el cuadro que generaría de forma predeterminada.

trans-unit.source: Browser support for flexbox is excellent, and the majority of browsers do not need a prefix at this point. trans-unit.source: Browsers are updating their rendering engines to remove this prefix, however the prefixed versions will be maintained as aliases, making them safe to use.

Browsers are updating their rendering engines to remove this prefix, however the prefixed versions will be maintained as aliases, making them safe to use. At the present time, some browsers do not support the unprefixed versions, which is why the live examples in this guide use grid- prefixed versions.
trans-unit.target: Los navegadores están actualizando sus motores de representación para eliminar este prefijo, sin embargo, las versiones prefijadas se mantendrán como alias, lo que las hará seguras para su uso. En la actualidad, algunos navegadores no son compatibles con las versiones no prefijadas, razón por la cual los ejemplos en vivo en esta guía usan versiones prefijadas de grid- .

trans-unit.source: Browsers are updating to remove this prefix, however the prefixed versions will be maintained as aliases making them safe to use.

Browsers are updating to remove this prefix, however the prefixed versions will be maintained as aliases making them safe to use. At the present time, some browsers do not support the unprefixed versions which is why the live examples in this guide use grid- prefixed versions.
trans-unit.target: Los navegadores se están actualizando para eliminar este prefijo,sin embargo,las versiones prefijadas se mantendrán como alias,lo que hace que su uso sea seguro.En la actualidad,algunos navegadores no soportan las versiones no fijas,por lo que los ejemplos en vivo de esta guía utilizan versiones con prefijos de cuadrícula.

trans-unit.source: Browsers display items as part of a block or inline formatting context in terms of what normally makes sense for that element. For example a strong element is used to highlight a word, and displays bold in browsers. It would not generally make sense for that strong element to be displayed as a block level element, breaking onto a new line. If you did want all strong elements to display as block elements, you could do so by setting display: block on strong. This means that you can always use the most semantic HTML element to markup your content, and then change the way it displays using CSS.
trans-unit.target: Los navegadores muestran elementos como parte de un bloque o contexto de formato en línea en términos de lo que normalmente tiene sentido para ese elemento. Por ejemplo, un elemento fuerte se utiliza para resaltar una palabra y se muestra en negrita en los navegadores. En general, no tendría sentido que ese elemento fuerte se muestre como un elemento de nivel de bloque, rompiendo en una nueva línea. Si desea que todos los elementos fuertes se muestren como elementos de bloque, puede hacerlo configurando display: block on strong . Esto significa que siempre puede usar el elemento HTML más semántico para marcar su contenido y luego cambiar la forma en que se muestra con CSS.

trans-unit.source: Browsers display items as part of a block or inline formatting context in terms of what normally makes sense for that element. For example, a <strong> element is used to highlight a word and displays bold in browsers. It would not generally make sense for that <strong> element to be displayed as a block level element, breaking onto a new line. If you did want all <strong> elements to display as block elements, you could do so by setting display: block on <strong>. This means that you can always use most of the semantic HTML elements to markup your content, and then change the way it displays using CSS.

Browsers do not provide any special information on background images to assistive technology. This is important primarily for screen readers, as a screen reader will not announce its presence and therefore convey nothing to its users. If the image contains information critical to understanding the page's overall purpose, it is better to describe it semantically in the document.

Browsers do not provide any special information on background images to assistive technology. This is important primarily for screen readers, as a screen reader will not announce its presence and therefore convey nothing to its users. If the image contains information critical to understanding the page's overall purpose, it is better to describe it semantically in the document. When using background images, make sure the contrast in color is great enough that any text is legible over the image as well as if the images is missing.

Browsers do not provide any special information on background images to assistive technology. This is important primarily for screen readers, as a screen reader will not announce its presence and therefore convey nothing to its users. While it is possible to create pie charts, checkerboards, and other effects with conic gradients, CSS images provide no native way to assign alternative text, and therefore the image represented by the conic gradient will not be accessible to screen reader users. If the image contains information critical to understanding the page's overall purpose, it is better to describe it semantically in the document.

Browsers have added an internal aspect-ratio property that applies to replaced elements and other related elements that accept width and height attributes. This appears in the browser's internal UA stylesheet.

Browsers often implement several more, prefixed, keywords: Gecko implements -moz-window, -moz-document, -moz-desktop, -moz-info, -moz-dialog, -moz-button, -moz-pull-down-menu, -moz-list, and -moz-field.
trans-unit.target: Los navegadores a menudo implementan varias palabras clave prefijadas más: Gecko implementa -moz-window , -moz-document , -moz-desktop , -moz-info , -moz-dialog , -moz-button , -moz-pull-down-menu , -moz-list y -moz-field .

trans-unit.source: Browsers that understand image() also understand the fragment notation. Therefore, if the fragment is not understood within image(), the image will be considered invalid.

Browsers will remove any element with a display value of contents set on it from the accessibility tree. This will cause the element and all its descendant elements to no longer be announced by screen reading technology.
trans-unit.target: Los navegadores eliminarán cualquier elemento con un valor de display de contents establecido en el árbol de accesibilidad . Esto hará que el elemento y todos sus elementos descendientes ya no sean anunciados por la tecnología de lectura de pantalla.

trans-unit.source: But the geometricPrecision property — when fully supported by the rendering engine — lets you scale your text fluidly. For large scale factors, you might see less-than-beautiful text rendering, but the size is what you would expect—neither rounded up nor down to the nearest font size supported by Windows or Linux.
trans-unit.target: Pero la propiedad geometricPrecision , cuando es totalmente compatible con el motor de renderizado, le permite escalar su texto de manera fluida. Para factores de gran escala, es posible que vea una representación de texto menos que hermosa, pero el tamaño es el que esperaría, ni redondeado hacia arriba ni hacia abajo al tamaño de fuente más cercano compatible con Windows o Linux.

trans-unit.source: By adding column-count or column-width to an element, that element becomes a multi-column container, or multicol container for short. The columns are anonymous boxes and described as column boxes in the specification.
trans-unit.target: Al agregar column-count column-width o el ancho de columna a un elemento, ese elemento se convierte en un contenedor de varias columnas , o contenedor multicol para abreviar. Las columnas son cuadros anónimos y se describen como cuadros de columnas en la especificación.

trans-unit.source: By adding display: contents to the wrapper around the nested elements, you can see that that item has disappeared from the layout, allowing the two sub-children to be laid out as if they were direct children of the flex container. You can try removing the display: contents line to see it return.
trans-unit.target: Al agregar display: contents al contenedor alrededor de los elementos anidados, puede ver que ese elemento ha desaparecido del diseño, lo que permite que los dos hijos secundarios se distribuyan como si fueran hijos directos del contenedor flexible. Puede intentar eliminar la display: contents línea de contenido para verla regresar.

trans-unit.source: By adding more angled color-stop points on the gradient arc, you can create a highly customized transition between multiple colors. A color-stop's position can be explicitly defined by using an <angle>. If you don't specify the location of a color stop, it is placed halfway between the one that precedes it and the one that follows it. If you don't specify an angle for the first or last color stop, their values are 0deg and 360deg respectively. The following two gradients are equivalent

By adding more angled color-stop points on the gradient arc, you can create a highly customized transition between multiple colors. A color-stop's position can be explicitly defined by using an <angle>. If you don't specify the location of a color stop, it is placed halfway between the one that precedes it and the one that follows it. Like the non-repeating gradient counterpart, If you don't specify an angle for the first or last color stop, the values are will be 0deg and 360deg. If you don't declare an angle for either, you'll get a non-repeating conic gradient. If you declare a non 0 or 360degree for the first or last respectively, the gradient will repeat based on that value. For example, if you don't declare an angle for the first color, and declare 10% on the last color stop, the arc will repeat 10 times. Rather, the starting point is the first color stop declared, and the last color stop is the last color stop angle declared.. The following two gradients are equivalent

By adding more color-stop points on the gradient line, you can create a highly customized transition between multiple colors. A color-stop's position can be explicitly defined by using a <length> or a <percentage>. If you don't specify the location of a color, it is placed halfway between the one that precedes it and the one that follows it. The following two gradients are equivalent.

By adding more color-stop points on the gradient line, you can create a highly customized transition between the starting and ending colors. A color-stop's position can be explicitly defined by using a <length> or a <percentage>. If you don't specify the location, it is placed halfway between the one that precedes it and the one that follows it.
trans-unit.target: Al agregar más puntos de detención de color en la línea de degradado, puede crear una transición altamente personalizada entre los colores inicial y final. La posición de una parada de color se puede definir explícitamente utilizando un <length> o un <percentage> . Si no especifica la ubicación, se coloca a medio camino entre la que le precede y la que le sigue.

trans-unit.source: By allowing authors to provide their own fonts, @font-face makes it possible to design content without being limited to the so-called "safe" fonts (that is, the fonts which are so common that they're considered to be universally available). The ability to specify the name of a locally-installed font to look for and use makes it possible to customize the font beyond the basics while making it possible to do so without relying on an Internet connection.
trans-unit.target: Al permitir a los autores proporcionar sus propias fuentes, @font-face hace posible diseñar contenido sin limitarse a las llamadas fuentes "seguras" (es decir, las fuentes que son tan comunes que se consideran universalmente disponibles). ) La capacidad de especificar el nombre de una fuente instalada localmente para buscar y usar hace que sea posible personalizar la fuente más allá de lo básico al tiempo que permite hacerlo sin depender de una conexión a Internet.

trans-unit.source: By allowing authors to provide their own fonts, @font-face makes it possible to design content without being limited to the so-called "web-safe" fonts (that is, the fonts which are so common that they're considered to be universally available). The ability to specify the name of a locally-installed font to look for and use makes it possible to customize the font beyond the basics while making it possible to do so without relying on an Internet connection.
By combining the align and justify properties we can easily center an item inside a grid area.
trans-unit.target: Combinando las propiedades de alineación y justificación podemos fácilmente centrar un elemento dentro de un área de la cuadrícula.

trans-unit.source: By default block elements will consume all of the space in the inline direction, so our paragraphs spread out and get as big as they can inside their containing block. If we give them a width, the will continue to lay out one below the other - even if there would be space for them to be side by side. Each will start against the start edge of the containing block, so the place at which sentences would begin in that writing mode.
trans-unit.target: Por defecto,los elementos del bloque consumirán todo el espacio en la dirección de la línea,por lo que nuestros párrafos se extienden y se hacen tan grandes como pueden dentro de su bloque de contención.Si les damos un ancho,continuarán colocándose uno debajo del otro,aunque haya espacio para que estén uno al lado del otro.Cada uno comenzará contra el borde inicial del bloque de contención,así que el lugar en el que las oraciones comenzarían en ese modo de escritura.

trans-unit.source: By default block elements will consume all of the space in the inline direction, so our paragraphs spread out and get as big as they can inside their containing block. If we give them a width, they will continue to lay out one below the other - even if there would be space for them to be side by side. Each will start against the start edge of the containing block, so the place at which sentences would begin in that writing mode.
By default flex items don't shrink below their minimum content size. To change this, set the item's min-width or min-height.
trans-unit.target: Por defecto, los elementos flexibles no se reducen por debajo de su tamaño mínimo de contenido. Para cambiar esto, configure el min-width min-height o la altura mínima del elemento .

trans-unit.source: By default in the CSS box model, the width and height you assign to an element is applied only to the element's content box. If the element has any border or padding, this is then added to the width and height to arrive at the size of the box that's rendered on the screen. This means that when you set width and height, you have to adjust the value you give to allow for any border or padding that may be added. For example, if you have four boxes with width: 25%;, if any has left or right padding or a left or right border, they will not by default fit on one line within the constraints of the parent container.

By default in the CSS box model, the width and height you assign to an element is applied only to the element's content box. If the element has any border or padding, this is then added to the width and height to arrive at the size of the box that's rendered on the screen. This means that when you set width and height, you have to adjust the value you give to allow for any border or padding that may be added.
trans-unit.target: De manera predeterminada en el modelo de cuadro CSS , el ancho y el alto que asigna a un elemento se aplican solo al cuadro de contenido del elemento. Si el elemento tiene algún borde o relleno, esto se agrega al ancho y alto para llegar al tamaño del cuadro que se muestra en la pantalla. Esto significa que cuando establece el ancho y la altura, debe ajustar el valor que le da para permitir cualquier borde o relleno que se pueda agregar.

trans-unit.source: By default, min-width is set as close as possible to the initial viewport considering the minimum width constraint.
trans-unit.target: De forma predeterminada, min-width se establece lo más cerca posible de la vista inicial teniendo en cuenta la restricción de ancho mínimo.

trans-unit.source: By default, Gecko applies a style that creates a red "glow" (using the box-shadow property) around items, which have this pseudo-class applied. See the :invalid pseudo-class for an example that shows how to override the default style.
trans-unit.target: De forma predeterminada, Gecko aplica un estilo que crea un "resplandor" rojo (usando la propiedad de box-shadow ) alrededor de los elementos, a los que se les aplica esta pseudoclase. Consulte la pseudoclase :invalid para ver un ejemplo que muestra cómo anular el estilo predeterminado.

trans-unit.source: By default, Gecko applies a style that creates a red "glow" (using the box-shadow property) around items, which have this pseudo-class applied. See the :invalid pseudo-class for an example that shows how to override the default style. The specification for :user-invalid is still in progress.

By default, Gecko does not apply a style to the :invalid pseudo-class. However, it does apply a style (a red "glow" using the box-shadow property) to the :-moz-ui-invalid pseudo-class, which applies in a subset of cases for :invalid.
trans-unit.target: Por defecto, Gecko no aplica un estilo a :invalid pseudo-clase inválida . Sin embargo, sí aplica un estilo (un "resplandor" rojo usando la propiedad box-shadow ) a la pseudo-clase :-moz-ui-invalid , que se aplica en un subconjunto de casos para :invalid .

trans-unit.source: By default, HTML's lang attribute tells browsers to display glyphs designed specifically for that language. For example, a lot of fonts have a special character for the digraph fi that merge the dot on the "i" with the "f." However, if the language is set to Turkish the typeface will likely know not to use the merged glyph; Turkish has two versions of the "i," one with a dot (i) and one without (ı), and using the ligature would incorrectly transform a dotted "i" into a dotless "i."
trans-unit.target: Por defecto, el atributo lang de HTML le dice a los navegadores que muestren glifos diseñados específicamente para ese idioma. Por ejemplo, muchas fuentes tienen un carácter especial para el fi del dígrafo que fusiona el punto en la "i" con la "f". Sin embargo, si el idioma está configurado en turco, es probable que la tipografía sepa que no debe usar el glifo combinado; El turco tiene dos versiones de la "i", una con un punto ( i ) y otra sin ( ı ), y el uso de la ligadura transformaría incorrectamente una "i" punteada en una "i" sin puntos.

trans-unit.source: By default, Safari on iOS does not use the :active state unless there is a touchstart event handler on the relevant element or on the <body> element.
trans-unit.target: De forma predeterminada, Safari en iOS no utiliza el estado :active a menos que haya un controlador de eventos de touchstart en el elemento relevante o en el elemento <body> .

trans-unit.source: By default, a gradient evenly progresses between the colors of two adjacent color stops, with the midpoint between those two color stops being the midpoint color value. You can control the interpolation, or progression, between two color stops by including a color hint location. In this example, the color reaches the midpoint between lime and cyan 20% of the way through the gradient rather than 50% of the way through. The second example does not contain the hint to hilight the difference the color hint can make:

By default, colors transition smoothly from the color at one color stop to the color at the subsequent color stop, with the midpoint between the colors being the half way point between the color transition. You can move this color transition midpoint to any point between two color stops by adding a color hint, indicating where the middle of the color transition should be.

By default, colors transition smoothly from the color at one color stop to the color at the subsequent color stop, with the midpoint between the colors being the half way point between the color transition. You can move this color transition midpoint to any point between two color stops by adding a color hint, indicating where the middle of the color transition should be. The following is solid red from the start to the 10% mark, transitions from red to blue over 80% of the turn, with the final 10% being solid blue. The midpoint of the red to blue gradient change, however, is at the 20% mark rather than the 50% mark as would have happened without the 80grad, or 20%, color hint.

By default, colors transition smoothly from the color at one color stop to the color at the subsequent color stop, with the midpoint between the colors being the half way point between the color transition. You can move this midpoint to any position between two color stops by adding an unlabelled % color hint between the two colors to indicate where the middle of the color transition should be. The following example is solid red from the start to the 10% mark and solid blue from 90% to the end. Between 10% and 90% the color transitions from red to blue, however the midpoint of the transition is at the 30% mark rather than 50% as would have happened without the 30% color hint.

By default, if there is no color with a 0% stop, the first color declared will be at that point. Similarly, the last color will continue to the 100% mark, or be at the 100% mark if no length has been declared on that last stop.

By default, it is possible for you to get a break between the image and its caption, which is not what we want. To avoid this, we have set break-inside: avoid on the <figure>, which causes them to always stay together.
By default, linear gradients run from top to bottom. You can change their rotation by specifying a direction.
trans-unit.target: Por defecto,los gradientes lineales van de arriba a abajo.Puedes cambiar su rotación especificando una dirección.

trans-unit.source: By default, mobile browsers tend to provide a "bounce" effect or even a page refresh when the top or bottom of a page (or other scroll area) is reached. You may also have noticed that when you have a dialog box with scrolling content on top of a page of scrolling content, once the dialog box's scroll boundary is reached, the underlying page will then start to scroll — this is called scroll chaining.
trans-unit.target: Por defecto, los navegadores móviles tienden a proporcionar un efecto de "rebote" o incluso una actualización de la página cuando se alcanza la parte superior o inferior de una página (u otra área de desplazamiento). También puede haber notado que cuando tiene un cuadro de diálogo con contenido desplazable en la parte superior de una página de contenido desplazable, una vez que se alcanza el límite de desplazamiento del cuadro de diálogo, la página subyacente comenzará a desplazarse; esto se llama encadenamiento de desplazamiento .

trans-unit.source: By default, most browsers apply a special color value to visited links. Thus, the links in this example will probably have special font colors only before you visit them. (After that, you'll need to clear your browser history to see them again.) However, the background-color values are likely to remain, as most browsers do not set that property on visited links by default.
trans-unit.target: Por defecto, la mayoría de los navegadores aplican un valor de color especial a los enlaces visitados. Por lo tanto, los enlaces en este ejemplo probablemente tendrán colores de fuente especiales solo antes de visitarlos. (Después de eso, deberá borrar el historial del navegador para verlos nuevamente). Sin embargo, es probable que los valores de background-color permanezcan, ya que la mayoría de los navegadores no configuran esa propiedad en los enlaces visitados de manera predeterminada.

trans-unit.source: By default, most browsers use an automatic table layout algorithm. The widths of the table and its cells are adjusted to fit the content.
trans-unit.target: Por defecto,la mayoría de los navegadores utilizan un algoritmo de diseño de tablas automático.El ancho de la tabla y sus celdas se ajustan para adaptarse al contenido.

trans-unit.source: By default, no style is applied. You can use this pseudo-class to customize the appearance of the submit button when there are invalid form fields.
trans-unit.target: Por defecto,no se aplica ningún estilo.Puedes usar esta pseudo-clase para personalizar la apariencia del botón de envío cuando hay campos de formulario inválidos.

trans-unit.source: By default, panning (scrolling) and pinching gestures are handled exclusively by the browser. An application using Pointer_events will receive a pointercancel event when the browser starts handling a touch gesture. By explicitly specifying which gestures should be handled by the browser, an application can supply its own behavior in pointermove and pointerup listeners for the remaining gestures. Applications using Touch_events disable the browser handling of gestures by calling preventDefault(), but should also use touch-action to ensure the browser knows the intent of the application before any event listeners have been invoked.
trans-unit.target: De forma predeterminada, el navegador maneja exclusivamente los movimientos panorámicos (desplazamiento) y los pellizcos. Una aplicación que utiliza Pointer_events recibirá un evento pointercancel cuando el navegador comience a manejar un gesto táctil. Al especificar explícitamente qué gestos debe manejar el navegador, una aplicación puede proporcionar su propio comportamiento en oyentes pointermove y pointerup para los gestos restantes. Las aplicaciones que usan Touch_events deshabilitan el manejo de gestos del navegador llamando a preventDefault() , pero también deben usar touch-action para garantizar que el navegador conozca la intención de la aplicación antes de que se invoque a los oyentes de eventos.

trans-unit.source: By default, panning (scrolling) and pinching gestures are handled exclusively by the browser. An application using Pointer events will receive a pointercancel event when the browser starts handling a touch gesture. By explicitly specifying which gestures should be handled by the browser, an application can supply its own behavior in pointermove and pointerup listeners for the remaining gestures. Applications using Touch events disable the browser handling of gestures by calling preventDefault(), but should also use touch-action to ensure the browser knows the intent of the application before any event listeners have been invoked.

By default, the different color stops you specify are spaced equidistantly around the circle. You can position the starting angle of the conic gradient using the "from" keyword at the beginning followed by an angle or a length, and you can specify different positions for the colors stops by including an angle or length after them.

By default, the gradient transitions evenly from one color to the next. You can include a color-hint to move the midpoint of the transition value to a certain point along the gradient. In this example, we've moved the midpoint of the transition from the 50% mark to the 10% mark.
By default, the origin of a transform is center.
By default, the repeated images are clipped to the size of the element, but they can be scaled to fit (using round) or evenly distributed from end to end (using space).
trans-unit.target: De forma predeterminada, las imágenes repetidas se recortan al tamaño del elemento, pero se pueden escalar para que quepan (usando round ) o distribuidas de manera uniforme de extremo a extremo (usando space ).

trans-unit.source: By default, the subheadings and paragraphs were laid out rather messily because the headings were not in a uniform place. However, we used break-after: column on the <p> elements to force a column break after each one, meaning that you end up with an <h2> neatly at the top of each column.

By default, the subheadings and paragraphs were laid out rather messily because the headings were not in a uniform place. However, we used break-before: column on the <h2> elements to force a column break before each one, meaning that you end up with an <h2> neatly at the top of each column.
By default, the width is set as close as possible to the initial viewport considering the maximum width constraint.
trans-unit.target: Por defecto,la anchura se establece lo más cerca posible del punto de vista inicial teniendo en cuenta la restricción de anchura máxima.

trans-unit.source: By default, when the inner box is scolled and a scroll boundary is reached, the whole page will begin to scroll, which is probably not what we want. To avoid this, you can set overscroll-behavior-x: contain on the inner box:
trans-unit.target: Por defecto, cuando el cuadro interno se desplaza y se alcanza un límite de desplazamiento, toda la página comenzará a desplazarse, lo que probablemente no sea lo que queremos. Para evitar esto, puede establecer overscroll-behavior-x: contain en el cuadro interno:

trans-unit.source: By default, when the inner box is scrolled and a scroll boundary is reached, the whole page will begin to scroll, which is probably not what we want. To avoid this happening in the block direction, we've set overscroll-behavior-block: contain on the inner box.

By default, when the inner box is scrolled and a scroll boundary is reached, the whole page will begin to scroll, which is probably not what we want. To avoid this happening in the inline direction, we've set overscroll-behavior-inline: contain on the inner box.

By default, when the inner box is scrolled and a scroll boundary is reached, the whole page will begin to scroll, which is probably not what we want. To avoid this, you can set overscroll-behavior-x: contain on the inner box:
By default, zoom-enabled elements can be zoomed by the user via pinch-zoom. The top-level element can also be zoomed via double-tap when it is zoom-enabled.
trans-unit.target: Por defecto,los elementos habilitados para el zoom pueden ser ampliados por el usuario a través de pinch-zoom.El elemento de nivel superior también puede ser ampliado mediante doble toque cuando está habilitado para el zoom.

trans-unit.source: By modifying the coordinate space, CSS transforms change the shape and position of the affected content without disrupting the normal document flow. This guide provides an introduction to using transforms.
trans-unit.target: Al modificar el espacio de coordenadas, las transformaciones CSS cambian la forma y la posición del contenido afectado sin interrumpir el flujo normal de documentos. Esta guía proporciona una introducción al uso de transformaciones.

trans-unit.source: By setting a margin of auto on one item in a set of flex items all aligned to start, we can create a split navigation. This works well with Flexbox and the alignment properties. As soon as there is no space available for the auto margin, the item behaves in the same way as all the other flex items and shrinks to try to fit into space.

By setting a margin of auto on one item in a set of flex items all aligned to start, we can create a split navigation. This works well with Flexbox and the alignment properties. As soon as there is no space available for the auto margin, the item behaves in the same way as all the other flex items and shrinks to try to fit into the space.
trans-unit.target: Al establecer un margin de auto móviles en un elemento en un conjunto de elementos flexibles todas alineadas para empezar, podemos crear una navegación dividida. Esto funciona bien con Flexbox y las propiedades de alineación. Tan pronto como no haya espacio disponible para el margen automático, el elemento se comporta de la misma manera que todos los demás elementos flexibles y se contrae para tratar de encajar en el espacio.

trans-unit.source: By setting its value to ignore, you can disable focusing the element, which means that the user will not be able to activate the element. The element will be skipped in the tab sequence.
trans-unit.target: Al configurar su valor para ignore , puede deshabilitar el enfoque del elemento, lo que significa que el usuario no podrá activar el elemento. El elemento se omitirá en la secuencia de pestañas.

trans-unit.source: By tabbing around any of the live examples on this page, you can see how order is potentially creating a strange experience for anyone not using a pointing device of some kind. To read more about this disconnect of visual order and logical order and some of the potential problems it raises for accessibility, see the following resources.
trans-unit.target: Al pasar por cualquiera de los ejemplos en vivo de esta página,puedes ver cómo el orden está creando potencialmente una experiencia extraña para cualquiera que no use un dispositivo señalador de algún tipo.Para leer más sobre esta desconexión del orden visual y el orden lógico y algunos de los problemas potenciales que plantea para la accesibilidad,consulta los siguientes recursos.

trans-unit.source: By using Box Values for Shapes we can wrap our content around the edges defined by these values. In all of the examples below I am using an element which has padding, a border, and a margin defined in order that you can see the different ways in which content will flow.
trans-unit.target: Usando los valores de caja para las formas podemos envolver nuestro contenido alrededor de los bordes definidos por estos valores.En todos los ejemplos siguientes estoy usando un elemento que tiene relleno,un borde y un margen definido para que puedas ver las diferentes formas en que el contenido fluirá.

trans-unit.source: CSS 2 used a single-keyword syntax for the display property, requiring separate keywords for block-level and inline-level variants of the same layout mode.
trans-unit.target: CSS 2 utilizó una sintaxis de una sola palabra clave para la propiedad de display , requiriendo palabras clave separadas para variantes de nivel de bloque y nivel de línea del mismo modo de diseño.

trans-unit.source: CSS 2 used a single-keyword syntax for the display property, requiring separate keywords for block-level and inline-level variants of the same layout mode. This page details those values.
trans-unit.target: CSS 2 utilizó una sintaxis de una sola palabra clave para la propiedad de display , requiriendo palabras clave separadas para variantes de nivel de bloque y nivel de línea del mismo modo de diseño. Esta página detalla esos valores.

trans-unit.source: CSS 2.0 defined only computed value as the last step in a property's calculation. Then, CSS 2.1 introduced the distinct definition of used value. An element could then explicitly inherit a width/height of a parent, whose computed value is a percentage. For CSS properties that don't depend on layout (e.g., display, font-size, or line-height), the computed values and used values are the same. The following are the CSS 2.1 properties that do depend on layout, so they have a different computed value and used value: (taken from CSS 2.1 Changes: Specified, computed, and actual values):
trans-unit.target: CSS 2.0 definió solo el valor calculado como el último paso en el cálculo de una propiedad. Luego, CSS 2.1 introdujo la definición distinta del valor utilizado. Un elemento podría heredar explícitamente un ancho / alto de un padre, cuyo valor calculado es un porcentaje. Para las propiedades CSS que no dependen del diseño (por ejemplo, display , font-size o line-height ), los valores calculados y los valores utilizados son los mismos. Las siguientes son las propiedades CSS 2.1 que dependen del diseño, por lo que tienen un valor calculado diferente y un valor usado: (tomado de CSS 2.1 Cambios: valores especificados, calculados y reales ):

trans-unit.source: CSS 2.0 defined only computed value as the last step in a property's calculation. Then, CSS 2.1 introduced the distinct definition of used value. An element could then explicitly inherit a width/height of a parent, whose computed value is a percentage. For CSS properties that don't depend on layout (e.g., display, font-size, or line-height), the computed values and used values are the same. trans-unit.source: CSS Animations make it possible to do incredible things with the elements that make up your documents and apps. However, there are things you might want to do that aren't obvious, or clever ways to do things that you might not come up with right away. This article is a collection of tips and tricks we've found that may make your work easier, including how to run a stopped animation again.
trans-unit.target: Las animaciones CSS permiten hacer cosas increíbles con los elementos que componen sus documentos y aplicaciones.Sin embargo,hay cosas que puedes querer hacer que no son obvias,o formas inteligentes de hacer cosas que no se te ocurren de inmediato.Este artículo es una colección de consejos y trucos que hemos encontrado y que pueden facilitarte el trabajo,incluyendo cómo volver a ejecutar una animación detenida.

trans-unit.source: CSS Grid Layout and accessibility
trans-unit.target: Diseño y accesibilidad de la grilla de CSS

trans-unit.source: CSS Grid Layout has been designed to work alongside other parts of CSS, as part of a complete system for doing the layout. In this guide, I will explain how a grid fits together with other techniques you may already be using.
trans-unit.target: El diseño de la grilla de CSS ha sido diseñado para trabajar junto con otras partes de CSS,como parte de un sistema completo para hacer el diseño.En esta guía,explicaré cómo una cuadrícula encaja con otras técnicas que ya puedes estar usando.

trans-unit.source: CSS Grid Layout implements the specification Box Alignment Level 3 which is the same standard flexbox uses for aligning items in its flex container. This specification details how alignment should work in all the different layout methods. Layout methods will conform to the specification where possible and implement individual behavior based on their differences (features and constraints). While the specification currently specifies alignment details for all layout methods, browsers have not fully implemented all of the specification; however, the CSS Grid Layout method has been widely adopted.

CSS Grid Layout, and the Box Alignment specification are designed to work with writing modes in CSS. This means that if you are working in a right to left language, such as Arabic, the start of the grid would be the top and right, so the default of justify-content: start would be for grid tracks to start on the right hand side of the grid.
trans-unit.target: El diseño de cuadrícula CSS y la especificación de alineación de caja están diseñados para funcionar con modos de escritura en CSS. Esto significa que si está trabajando en un idioma de derecha a izquierda, como el árabe, el inicio de la cuadrícula sería la parte superior y la derecha, por lo que el valor predeterminado de justify-content: start sería que las pistas de la cuadrícula comiencen en la mano derecha lado de la cuadrícula.

trans-unit.source: CSS Level 1 only included 16 basic colors, called the VGA colors as they were taken from the set of displayable colors on VGA graphics cards.
